ingredients.item: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces

instructions.step: Heat oil and saute; garlic and onion until translucent.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and water. Simmer until chicken is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Mix in green peas and bell pepper. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly, cut into chunks

instructions.step: Boil pork in water with onions and tomatoes until pork is tender.
Add radish, sitaw, and eggplant. Cook until vegetables are half-cooked.
Pour in sinigang mix and stir well.
Add kangkong last and cook for 1–2 minutes.
Season with fish sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: Fry pork until browned and crispy. Set aside.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until soft.
Add bagoong and mix well.
Add squash and water. Cook until slightly tender.
Add string beans, eggplant, and ampalaya. Simmer until cooked but still crisp.
Top with fried pork before serving.
Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, and garlic for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil and fry onion rings. Set aside.
In the same pan, fry beef slices until cooked.
Pour remaining marinade and simmer beef until tender.
Top with fried onions before serving.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add shrimp and cook until it turns pink.
Pour coconut cream and continue simmering until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper. Add chili if desired.
Serve hot with rice.
Arrange bangus, eggplant, onion, ginger, and garlic in a pot.
Pour vinegar and water over the ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Simmer until fish is cooked and flavors are absorbed.
Serve hot with rice.
Boil beef until tender. Set aside broth.
Sauté garlic and onion, add beef, then tomato sauce.
Add broth back in and simmer.
Add sweet potatoes, saba bananas, and green beans.
When vegetables are almost cooked, add cabbage and pechay.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.
In a pot, arrange taro leaves without stirring once coconut milk is added.
Pour coconut milk and add garlic, onion, ginger, and dried seafood.
Simmer on low heat without stirring until leaves absorb the coconut milk.
Add coconut cream and chilies, then cook until oil surfaces.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg oxtail (or beef shank/tripe), cut into pieces
1/4 cup ground toasted rice (optional, for thickening)
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: Boil oxtail until tender (about 1–1.5 hours). Set aside broth.
Heat oil in a large pan. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add boiled meat and some broth. Simmer.
Stir in peanut butter until fully dissolved.
Add ground rice to thicken the sauce (optional).
Add vegetables (string beans, banana heart, eggplant) and cook until tender.
Add pechay last and cook for 1–2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with bagoong on the side.
Marinate pork belly in soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, pepper, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Grill over hot charcoal until fully cooked and slightly charred.
Serve with dipping sauce or rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly (or pork shoulder), cut into chunks
1 tsp whole black peppercorns (or 1/2 tsp ground black pepper)
1 tbsp brown sugar (optional, for a slightly sweet touch)

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine pork, soy sauce, half of the crushed garlic, and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes (best if 1–2 hours).
Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the remaining garlic (and onions if using) until fragrant and slightly golden.
Add the marinated pork pieces into the pan. Cook until they are lightly browned on the edges.
Pour the marinade into the pan along with water. Stir and add the bay leaves.
Bring to a boil, then lower the heat. Cover and let it simmer for about 40–50 minutes, or until the pork becomes tender.
Pour in the vinegar. Let it boil for about 3–5 minutes without stirring to cook off the vinegar's strong taste.
Stir gently. Add sugar if you want a little sweetness. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed (you can add a little more salt or soy sauce).
Simmer uncovered until the sauce is slightly thickened, depending on how saucy or dry you want your adobo.
Serve hot with steamed rice!

ingredients.item: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
2 cups green papaya or chayote, sliced

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until aromatic.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour fish sauce and stir well.
Add water and chicken broth
bring to a boil.
Simmer until chicken is cooked through (around 25 minutes).
Add green papaya and cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add spinach or malunggay leaves. Cook for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour tomato sauce and beef broth. Bring to a boil.
Simmer until beef is tender (around 1 hour).
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender.
Mix in liver spread and bell peppers.
Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 5 pcs long green chilies, sliced diagonally

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and chilies.
Pour coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender.
Add coconut cream and cook until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup lechon sauce (Mang Tomas or homemade)

instructions.step: In a pot, combine lechon, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and water.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Simmer until lechon is tender (about 30 minutes).
Add lechon sauce and continue simmering until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper if needed.
Serve hot with rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce and tomato sauce. Stir well.
Add potatoes, carrots, and liver. Simmer until tender.
Mix in bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with steamed rice.
Boil mung beans in water until soft (about 40 minutes).
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato in a separate pan.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Mix pork into the mung beans pot.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add spinach or ampalaya leaves before serving.
Serve hot.
Grill or boil the eggplants until the skin is charred.
Peel off the skin carefully while keeping the eggplant whole.
Flatten the eggplant with a fork.
Beat the eggs with salt and pepper.
Dip each eggplant in the beaten eggs.
Fry the eggplant in hot oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with ketchup or rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef brisket, cut into chunks

instructions.step: Heat oil and sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and beef broth. Simmer until beef is tender (about 1 hour).
Add liver spread, potatoes, and carrots. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Mix in green peas and bell peppers. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Heat oil in a pan and cook the beef tapa until browned and tender.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs to your preference.
Assemble a plate with tapa, sinangag, and egg (silog).
Serve with vinegar sauce on the side if desired.
Boil longganisa in a small amount of water until water evaporates.
Let longganisa fry in its own oil until cooked and caramelized.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve longganisa with sinangag and egg.
Fry the marinated bangus in hot oil until crispy and golden.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve bangus with sinangag and egg.
Boil glutinous rice in water until soft and porridge-like.
Stir in cocoa powder and sugar until well mixed.
Cook for another 5–10 minutes until thickened.
Serve hot with a drizzle of condensed milk.
Mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast in a bowl.
Gradually add milk and melted butter
knead until smooth.
Let dough rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Shape into small balls and roll in breadcrumbs.
Let rise again for 30 minutes.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 15–20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm.

ingredients.item: Toasted garlic and spring onions for garnish

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until aromatic.
Add chicken pieces and cook until no longer pink.
Add rice and stir to coat with oil.
Pour in chicken broth and simmer until rice is soft and porridge-like.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with toasted garlic, spring onions, and calamansi.
Fry Spam slices in a pan until crispy.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Assemble Spam, sinangag, and egg on a plate.
Serve hot.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the milkfish until crispy and golden brown.
Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve with vinegar dipping sauce and garlic rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour soy sauce, sugar, and black pepper
mix well.
Pour beef broth and simmer until beef is tender.
Serve with garlic fried rice and a small bowl of beef soup.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add corned beef and cook for 5 minutes.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve corned beef with sinangag and egg.
test 1
